definition: to supply again (sth lost)/to reissue/to pay retroactively
to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: This is a major reissue of a book used by students of Vsevolod Meyerhold across the world.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個由梅耶荷德世界各地的學生用的書主要補發。

sentences.english: Please re-issue new card to me & charge all handling fees incurred.
sentences.chinese: 請補發新卡予本人及扣除一切手續費。

sentences.english: Perhaps as interest grows, more of his novels will be re-issued .
sentences.chinese: 也許是人們由更多的興趣，很多他的小說都會補發。

sentences.english: Please re-issue new card to me and charge all handling fees incurred.
sentences.chinese: 請補發新卡予本人及扣除一切手續費。

sentences.english: Lasting nearly two hours, Allegro Film's latest reissue is in three sections.
sentences.chinese: 持續近兩個小時，快板電影的最新補發的三個部分。

sentences.english: Modern events sometime demand the reissue of a book published several years ago.
sentences.chinese: 現代事件有時要求幾年前出版的一本書補發。

sentences.english: Please inform us in immediately this transmission is incompletely or illegibly or illegibly received.
sentences.chinese: 圖文傳真如不清晰，請速通知，以便補發。
補發號碼布費用爲港幣10元。

sentences.english: The cash coupons are not replaceable in case of loss or damage.
sentences.chinese: 現金券如有遺失或損毀，恕不補發。

sentences.english: I lost my ticket.Could you issue me another?
sentences.chinese: 我的車票丟了，你能再補發一張嗎？

sentences.english: Certificates of Attendance will not be re-issued.
sentences.chinese: 所有聽講證書將不予補發。

sentences.english: By the day after tomorrow, can I have the ticket reissued?
sentences.chinese: 到後天可以補發機票給我嗎？

sentences.english: I lost my ticket. Could you issue me another?
sentences.chinese: 我的車票掉了，你能再補發一張嗎？

sentences.english: Request for issue of new password for Wing Lung NET Banking.
sentences.chinese: 申請補發永隆網上銀行密碼。

definition: to repay a debt in full/to redeem/to clear
to issue (a document)/to sign and issue officially
to publish (in newspapers or magazines)/to record (bookkeeping entries)
to transfer (money to a bank account)
